column4: hey guyz, when i download and burn the iso image on dvd it is not bootable (and yes, i know how to burn an iso image :-) ) but the iso contains wubi and autostart refers to it...
i need an image without wubi... just a regular bootable install dvd
what version are you downloading and what medium?
current 12.10 or 12.04
which one? I believe 12.10 is like 800 megs and wont burn to a normal cd. And check the md5sum
yes, both of them... and isnt it possible to burn it on dvd?
this is the point of my question as to medium, but you did not answer, so I was just throwing out possibilities...
downloaded both, both are bigger than a cd, so i burned it on a dvd
try using a usb thumbdrive. It is faster without medium problems.
ubottu: i guess i have to try, but why is wubi in the damn iso? i don't want an wubi edition
i already got one and just trying to increas the disk size, and the guide says i need a livecd
what are you on now
i got a wubi installation on a special partition, and ubuntu complains that there is not enough space
and dev/loop i guess is 98% full, i've found out that the virtual disk is full and i have to increase it... followed the guide on ubuntu to increase the disk size
there is said that i need a livecd to increase it, the wubi disk duplicate is not an option
Or use windows to create the thumb. Its in the guide.
what is it? haven't heard of it
in which way would it help me solve my problem?
it would allow you to create a "live cd" on a USB drive, which you would then boot to... just as if it were a CD.
ok, thx for your input... i'll give it a try
from which point you can do a dual install...
